David

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Is it ok to have a Paladin Bard where you play (still Awakening)? It's just that standard rules mean it's a non-starter. Could do it with Sorcerer, though.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: It does not have to be bard.  I also play on Tornado of Souls

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
In the standard rules, a paladin must be lawful good, and will become a fallen paladin if he ever becomes not lawful good, even if he later becomes once again lawful good. Meanwhile, a bard is forbidden to be lawful, although I have heard of a PW that allows lawful bards.

You want only 30 STR at level 40 in a build with RDD. I guess that means that you want a good CHA, too.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Search the 40's section David, there is plenty of Paladin's there and i think one is by Tyr that is Paladin 26/ Bard 4/ RDD 10 & Paladin 29/ Sorcerer 1/ RDD 10 too. Both have over 30 Strength by lvl 40. There are also some builds in the Legacy Archive as well.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
Are you talking about Wing Commander?  I like that one but it has dev crit.  I can't have dev crit.  I could
just sub something for it but there may be feats in the build that are taken just to get dev crit.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes, that one with the 40 Str, (PAL 26/ BARD 4/ RDD 10).

Here is what you should do, change these three feats: Great Cleave, Overwhelming Critical & Devastating Critical with Great Fortitude, Greeat Strength I & Great Strength II.
Then you should end at 42 STR & AB 50.
